title: STRATEGIC ADVISORS FOR THE ESRC/DFID JOINT RESEARCH SCHEME ON INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT
abstractText:
The ESRC / DFID Joint Research Scheme aims to enhance the quality and impact of social science research addressing the key international development goal of reducing poverty amongst the poorest countries and peoples of the world.

It funds world class scientific research on issues relating to economic development and quality of life in less developed countries with the potential for impact on policy and practice for poverty reduction.
 
The Strategic Advisory Team to the scheme will contribute to enhancing the impact of this successful and globally-respected research programme. 

The team will build capacity to deliver impact for the scheme using three interlinked approaches; turning research into results, evaluation, and influencing and scaling up through communication. 

Delivery will be supported through various activities to be hosted by the SAT which will, where possible, adopt the use of new technology to enhance accessibility to the ESRC / DFID research community around the world.
